Class Notation

  • java.lang.Object
    • Notation

  • public class Notation
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a notation utility capable of converting and evaluating expressions containing arithmetic operators and operands. It contains static methods for converting infix expressions to postfix expressions and postfix expressions to infix expressions as well as a method for evaluating postfix expressions.
    Author:
    hudson

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Notation()
      No-arg constructor

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.lang.String convertInfixToPostfix(java.lang.String infix)
      This method takes an infix expression in the form of a string and converts it to a postfix expression.
      static java.lang.String convertPostfixToInfix(java.lang.String postfix)
      This method takes a postfix expression in the form of a string and converts it to a infix expression.
      static double evaluatePostfixExpression(java.lang.String postFix)
      This method evaluates a postfix expression by performing the operations indicated by the postfix expression using a stack of type Double.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Notation

        public Notation()
        No-arg constructor

    • Method Detail

      • convertInfixToPostfix

        public static java.lang.String convertInfixToPostfix(java.lang.String infix)
                                              throws InvalidNotationFormatException
        This method takes an infix expression in the form of a string and converts it to a postfix expression.
        Parameters:
        infix - The expression to be converted to a postfix expression.
        Returns:
        The postfix expression.
        Throws:
        InvalidNotationFormatException - If the infix expression is imbalanced.

      • convertPostfixToInfix

        public static java.lang.String convertPostfixToInfix(java.lang.String postfix)
                                              throws InvalidNotationFormatException
        This method takes a postfix expression in the form of a string and converts it to a infix expression.
        Parameters:
        postfix - The expression to be converted to an infix expression.
        Returns:
        The infix expression.
        Throws:
        InvalidNotationFormatException - If the number of operands in the stack is less than two or there are more than two values in the stack at the conclusion of the conversion.

      • evaluatePostfixExpression

        public static double evaluatePostfixExpression(java.lang.String postFix)
                                        throws InvalidNotationFormatException,
                                               StackUnderflowException
        This method evaluates a postfix expression by performing the operations indicated by the postfix expression using a stack of type Double.
        Parameters:
        postFix - The postfix expression to be evaluated.
        Returns:
        The result of evaluating the operations of the postfix expression.
        Throws:
        InvalidNotationFormatException - If the stack contains fewer than two operands when a given operator is identified.
        StackUnderflowException - If values are popped from an empty stack.
